meanings.definition: To cut into pieces with a sharp tool
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to chop the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef will chop the onions finely for the sauce.
meanings.sent3: I tried to chop the wood with a spoon, but it didn't work!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to chop through her defenses, leaving her vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the axe chopping echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: A thick, firm cut of meat
meanings.sent1: The butcher displayed a beautiful chop of beef in the shop window.
meanings.sent2: I prefer to grill pork chops for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The giant chop on his plate made his mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The chop on the plate looked like a piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The savory aroma of the chop filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A swift downward blow or stroke
meanings.sent1: He felt a sharp chop on his shoulder during the game.
meanings.sent2: The karate master delivered a powerful chop to the wooden board.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand made a chop in the air before the trick.
meanings.sent4: The chop of the axe split the log in half effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The chop of the sword ended the duel decisively.

meanings.sent1: The company had to chop its budget due to financial constraints.
meanings.sent2: They decided to chop the prices to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: She had to chop her to-do list in half to manage her time better.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected expenses forced them to chop their vacation plans.
meanings.sent5: The decision to chop the staff was a difficult one for the manager.

meanings.definition: A mark or indentation made by chopping
meanings.sent1: The woodcutter admired the clean chop he made on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor added a precise chop to the marble block.
meanings.sent3: The chop on the table showed the history of the old chopping board.
meanings.sent4: The chop on the door revealed the strength of the intruder.
meanings.sent5: The chop on the log displayed the wood's age and quality.
